get.description: Returns a list of events.

parameters.name: UpdatedSince
parameters.description:
Filter by events updated since a specified time.
Supported date formats are ISO YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss or .net ticks representation of the UTC datetime.

parameters.name: MatterId
parameters.description: Filter by events assigned to a specific MatterId.

parameters.name: ExcludeDeletedEvents
parameters.description: Filter out any events that have been deleted, default: false

parameters.name: From
parameters.description:
Filter events from a specified UTC date and time.
Defaults to the UTC datetime of the request.
Dates should be provided in ISO format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.

parameters.name: To
parameters.description:
Filter events to a specified UTC date and time.
If no datetime is specified all future events will be returned.
Dates should be provided in ISO format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.

get.description:
Returns a paginated list of matter types based on search criteria. Deleted matter types are not included.

Note: If no `Location` is provided, all matter types from all locations will be returned.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: Searches for partial match on matter type name

parameters.name: Location
parameters.description: Return matter types from a specific location. In the US API this is the ANSI 2 letter state code (e.g. IL, NY). In the AU API this is shorthand state code (e.g. NSW, ACT, etc)

parameters.name: Category
parameters.description: Return matter types from a specific category.

parameters.name: Type
parameters.description:
Return matter types by category type (i.e. MatterType or LeadType).
            
Possible values: Matter Type = 0, Lead Type = 1.

200.description: When request is successful. Returns a paged collection of 'MatterTypeInfo' objects.

get.description: Retrieves a specified matter type.

200.description: When request is successful. Returns a 'MatterType' object.

404.description: When matter type with specified id does not exist.

get.description: Returns a list of all the possible matter type categories.

200.description: When request is successful. Returns all 'Categories'.

get.description: Returns a list of matters.

parameters.name: Search
parameters.description:
Filter matters by specified search term.
This field is wide reaching, it is used to search by clients, othersides, description and matter numbers.

parameters.name: MatterTypeId
parameters.description: Filter by matter type identifier.

parameters.name: ContactId
parameters.description: Filter by the contact identifier.

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description:
Filter by current status of the matter.

Possible values: Open, Pending, Closed, Deleted or Cancelled.

parameters.name: IsLead
parameters.description: Boolean flag to restrict search to 'Leads'.

parameters.name: UpdatedSince
parameters.description: Filter by matters updated since a specified time (.net ticks representation of the UTC datetime). Cannot be used in conjunction with `LastUpdated`.

parameters.name: LastUpdated
parameters.description: Filter by last updated date of matter. Cannot be used in conjunction with `UpdatedSince`.

parameters.name: Sort
parameters.description: Available fields: status, lastUpdated

parameters.name: Fields
parameters.description: Available fields: items

200.description: When request is successful. Returns a list of `Matter` objects.

post.description:
Creates a new matter.
            
Note: This endpoint can also be used to create a `Lead`.

When creating a `Lead` you MUST remember to set a valid lead specific `matterTypeId` field (see field description below for more details) and set the `isLead` field to true.

The `clientRole` and `otherSideRole` are optional and cannot be identical. They will be set to the default role(s) for the specified matter type - if not provided.

202.description: When request is accepted. Returns a hypermedia `Link` object of the matter to be created.

400.description: When an unsupported request is made or a mandatory field - i.e. client, matter type, status - is not provided.

get.description: Retrieves a specified matter.

200.description: When request is successful. Returns a `Matter` object.

403.description: When the authenticated account does not have access to the matter.

404.description: When matter with specified id does not exist.

put.description:
Updates a specified matter.
            
The following actions are currently not supported:
            
- `matterTypeId` cannot be modified, unless converting a lead to a matter
            
- `clientIds` cannot be modified
            
- `otherSideIds` cannot be modified

-  `Matter` cannot be converted back to `Lead`

202.description: When request is accepted. Returns a hypermedia `Link` object of the matter to be updated.

400.description: When an unsupported request is made.

403.description: When the authenticated account does not have access to the matter.

404.description: When matter with specified id does not exist.

patch.description:
Patches a specified matter.
            
Note: This endpoint can also be used to update a `Lead` and to convert `Lead` to `Matter`.
            
See `Matters` documentation for more details on how to use this.

The following actions are not supported:

- `items` cannot be updated where either `clientIds` and/or `otherSideIds` are being updated
            
- `items` cannot be updated when converting a `Lead` to `Matter`
            
- `matterTypeId` and `clientRole` cannot be updated, unless converting a `Lead` to `Matter`
            
- `Matter` cannot be converted back to `Lead`

202.description: When request is accepted. Returns a hypermedia `Link` object of the matter to be patched.

400.description: When an unsupported request is made.

403.description: When the authenticated account does not have access to the matter.

404.description: When matter with specified id does not exist.

delete.description: Deletes a specified matter.

202.description: When request is accepted. Returns a hypermedia `Link` object of the matter to be deleted.

400.description: Bad Request

403.description: When the authenticated account does not have access to the matter.

404.description: When matter with specified id does not exist.

patch.description:
Cancels a subscription using the supplied cancellation request.

Supported cancellation types:
* PeriodEnd - Cancel subscription at the end of the billing cycle
* Immediate - Cancel subscription immediately
* Date - Cancel at specified 'CancelAt' date

If not supplied, PeriodEnd is used and the subscription is cancelled at the end of the billing cycle.

Important considerations:
* If the subscription is trialing a tier, the tier is reverted to the previous tier at the end of the trials duration. This is only supported with PeriodEnd CancellationType.
* If the subscription is trialing an add-on, the add-on is removed at the end of the trials duration. This is only supported with PeriodEnd CancellationType.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the subscription

200.description: Successfully cancelled the subscription

400.description: Invalid parameters or subscription is already canceled

404.description: Subscription not found

500.description: Internal server error occurred while canceling the subscription

patch.description:
Resumes a subscription that is pending cancellation or is already canceled.

If the subscription is in a CANCELED state:
 * An immediate charge for the subscription amount will be trigered.
 * If the charge is unsuccessful, the subscription will be moved to PASTDUE status until a charge is successful.
 * If all charge retry attempts fail, the subscription will be become CANCELED once again.
If the subscription is in the PENDING cancellation state:
 * The existing billing cycle will remain in place

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the subscription

200.description: Successfully resumed the subscription

202.description: Accepted

400.description: Invalid parameters or subscription is not canceled or pending cancellation

404.description: Subscription not found

500.description: Internal server error occurred while resuming the subscription

Quantity of the activity. This is the default value used when creating an expense or time-based fee.

For type 'Expense', this field represents the quantity of the expense in units.
For type 'Time', this field represents the duration of in minutes, divided by 100,
e.g. for 1 hour duration, quantity is 0.6, which is 60 minutes divided by 100.

Applies only for 'Time' and 'Expense' types. Not applicable for activity type 'Fixed'.

taxInclusive.description:

GST inclusive means: Amount exc. GST = Amount - GST, Amount inc. GST = Amount.

GST exclusive means: Amount exc. GST = Amount, Amount inc. GST = Amount + GST.

eventType.description:

nonBillable.description:
Whether or not the event is billable.
Note events with a duration greater than 12 hours automatically become non-billable.

startTime.description:
Start date and time of the event.
Supported date format is ISO YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.
Note: date and time will correlate with the time zone provided.

endTime.description:
End date and time of the event.
Supported date format is ISO YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.
Note: date and time will correlate with the time zone provided.

timeZone.description:
Time zone of the event for determining the start time and end time.
Time zones will be in the IANA time zone format.

Supported date format is ISO YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.

versionId.description: Unique version identifier of the expense.

createdByUserId.description: Unique identifier of the user that created the expense.

staff.description: The staff member associated to the expense.

matter.description: The matter associated to the expense.

invoiceId.description: Unique identifier of the associated invoice.

activityCode.description: The activity code associated to the expense.

utbmsTaskCode.description: The UTBMS task code associated to the expense, where UTBMS is enabled. Only applicable in US.

subject.description: The subject - this should be a short description of the expense.

description.description: Optional detailed description of the expense.

quantity.description:
The quantity of the expense in units (if not applicable, use 1).

The expense amount will be calculated as Quantity * Price.

price.description:
The price of the expense in dollars. Limited to 2 decimal places (cents).

The expense amount will be calculated as Quantity * Price.

amount.description:
Total amount of the expense. Calculated as Price * Quantity.

This amount ignores GST (if applicable). See AmountExcTax and AmountIncTax.

amountExcTax.description:
Amount excluding tax. Calculated from Amount and Tax depending on the TaxInclusive property.

If tax is not applicable (outside AU), this will be the same as Amount.

amountIncTax.description:
Amount including tax. Calculated from Amount and Tax depending on the TaxInclusive property.

If tax is not applicable (outside AU), this will be the same as Amount.

tax.description: GST amount of the expense in dollars. Only applicable in AU.

taxInclusive.description:
If true, the amount is GST inclusive, otherwise GST exclusive. Only applicable in AU.

GST inclusive means: Amount exc. GST = Amount - GST, Amount inc. GST = Amount.

GST exclusive means: Amount exc. GST = Amount, Amount inc. GST = Amount + GST.
(Amount = Price * Quantity, GST = value of the Tax field)

finalized.description: True if the expense has been finalized.

isWrittenOff.description:
True if the expense is written off. True only allowed if IsBillable is true. 

Written off expenses will show on an invoice with their amount, but will not be counted in the invoice total.

isBillable.description: True if the expense is billable. Non-billable expense will, by default, not be shown on invoices (and, if shown, the amount will be 0).

isInvoicedExternally.description: True if the expense is invoiced externally.

isDeleted.description: True if the expense is deleted.

updatedByUserId.description:
Unique identifier of the user updating the expense.

This field is reserved for server-to-server operations.

staffId.description:
Unique identifier of the associated staff member.

When StaffId is not provided, the API will attempt to match your User Id to a Staff Id automatically.

True if the fee is written off. True only allowed if IsBillable is true.

isBillable.description: True if the fee is billable. Non-billable fee will, by default, not be shown on invoices (and, if shown, the amount will be 0).

tax.description: GST amount of the fee in dollars. Only applicable in AU.

taxInclusive.description:
If true, the amount is GST inclusive, otherwise GST exclusive. Only applicable in AU.

GST inclusive means: Amount exc. GST = Amount - GST, Amount inc. GST = Amount.

GST exclusive means: Amount exc. GST = Amount, Amount inc. GST = Amount + GST.

rate.description: The rate of the fee in dollars.

amount.description:
Total amount of the fee in dollars. Calculated using Rate and Duration depending on the fee type.

This amount includes tax depending on the TaxInclusive property. See AmountExcTax and AmountIncTax.

amountExcTax.description:
Amount excluding tax in dollars. Calculated from Amount and Tax depending on the TaxInclusive property.

If tax is not applicable (outside AU), this will be the same as Amount.

amountIncTax.description:
Amount including tax in dollars. Calculated from Amount and Tax depending on the TaxInclusive property.

If tax is not applicable (outside AU), this will be the same as Amount.

billableAmountExcTax.description:
Billable amount excluding tax in dollars. If fee is billable, value will be the same as AmountExcTax. If it's non-billable,
value will be 0.

If the fee is partially billable (i.e. has source items, some of which are billable and some not),
this value will contain the amount calculated from billable items only.

billableTax.description:
Billable tax in dollars. If fee is billable, value will be the same as Tax. If it's non-billable,
value will be 0.

If the fee is partially billable (i.e. has source items, some of which are billable
and some not), this value will contain the tax calculated from billable items only.
In all other cases, the value will be the same as Tax.

* None - No cancellation type has been set.

* PeriodEnd - Cancel subscription at the end of the billing cycle.

* Immediate - Cancel subscription immediately.

* Date - Cancel at specified date - see 'CancelAt'.

cancelAt.description:
Optional date used to cancel at the supplied date. Will only be used if CancellationType is set to 'Date'.

If set to a date before the current period ends, this will cause a proration if prorations have been enabled.

If set during a future period, this will always cause a proration for that period.

reason.description: Optional reason for cancellation of the subscription.

preview.description:
Optional flag to preview cancellation request. 

If 'true', the Subscription is not cancelled and the CancellationType and CancellationDate are returned.
True if this is a cancellation preview.

cancellationType.description:
The subscription cancellation type.

* None - No cancellation type has been set.

* PeriodEnd - Cancel subscription at the end of the billing cycle.

* Immediate - Cancel subscription immediately.

* Date - Cancel at specified date - see 'CancelAt'.

cancellationBehaviour.description:
The subscription cancellation behaviour.

* Cancel - Standard behaviour. The subscription will be canceled as normal.

* CancelTrials - Any trials applied to the subscription will be canceled.

cancelAt.description: The date the subscription will be cancelled.

tier.description: The tier that will be set at the as a result of the cancellation.

addOns.description: The add-ons that will be set at the as a result of the cancellation.

id.description: Unique identifier of the payment method.

type.description:
The payment type.

* None - The payment type is missing or unknown.

* CreditCard - Credit Card payment type.

* DirectDeposit - Direct Deposit payment type. (not currently supported)

isDefault.description: Whether this is the default payment method for the customer.

details.description: Payment method specific details for display.

lastPaymentState.description:
The status of a payment.

* None: The payment status is unknown.

* Succeeded: The payment was successful.

* Processing: The payment is being processed.

* Canceled: The payment was canceled.

* Failed: The payment requires a payment method to be provided, the provided payment method failed or other action is required (e.g. confirmation or other action by the customer)

createdDate.description: When this payment method was added.

brand.description: The brand of the credit card.

lastFourDigits.description: Last four digits of the credit card.

expiry.description: Expiry date of the credit card in MM/YY format.

accountNumber.description:
The account number of the direct deposit account.

Not yet supported.

bsb.description:
The BSB of the direct deposit account.

Not yet supported.

items.description:
The payment type.

* None - The payment type is missing or unknown.

* CreditCard - Credit Card payment type.

* DirectDeposit - Direct Deposit payment type. (not currently supported)

supportedPaymentTypes.description: List of supported payment method types.

default.description: Returns `true` if the price is the default price.

active.description: Returns `true` if the Price is active.

type.description: The type of price.

amount.description: The per user amount for this pricing option for the specified interval (in cents).

productSuite.description: The product suite that this promotion belongs to.

tiers.description:
List of tiers this promotion can be applied to.
If tiers and add-ons are both empty, the promotion can be applied to any tier or add-on.

addOns.description:
List of add-ons this promotion can be applied to.
If tiers and add-ons are both empty, the promotion can be applied to any tier or add-on.

items.description:
The usage context of a promotion.

The context can be used by apps to determine how and when to apply a promotion.

usage.description:
Intended usage type for this promotion.

* Manual - Promotion can be applied manually at any time (with a code).

* Trial - The promotion can be used for trialing tiers or add-ons.

* CancelRetention - The promotion can be used when the user is trying to cancel their subscription.

* DowngradeRetention - The promotion can be used when the user is trying to downgrade their subscription.

* Signup - The promotion can be used on sign up.

durationType.description:
Type of duration for this promotion.

* None - Duration cannot be determined.

* Forever - Promotion applies indefinitely.

* Once - Promotion applies once then expires.

* Repeating - Promotion applies for a specified number of months.

durationMonths.description: Number of months the promotion applies for if DurationType is Repeating.

trialPeriodDays.description:
If the promotion is a trial promotion, how many days the associated tier or add-on will be trialed for.

Note: This will return null or 0 if the promotion is not trialable.

amountOff.description:
Fixed amount off (in cents).
Only one of AmountOff or PercentOff will be set.

percentOff.description:
Percentage discount.
Only one of AmountOff or PercentOff will be set.

active.description: Whether the promotion is currently valid and can be applied.

numUsed.description: Number of times this promotion has been used.

expirationDate.description:
When the promotion expires.
Null if the promotion does not expire.

codes.description: List of promotion codes associated with this promotion.

metadata.description: Additional metadata associated with the promotion code.

isPersistent.description:
Whether the promotion persists across tier switches.

For example, if a BILL only promotion is applied to the subscription and the firm upgrades to BOOST, the Promotion should be deactivated.

* If the promotion is non-persistent, it should be removed completely.

* If the promotion is persistent and the firm reverts back to BILL at a later date, the promotion should automatically be reactivated.

isFree.description: Whether this promotion makes the targeted tier or add-on free.

deleted.description: Whether this promotion has been deleted.

id.description: Unique identifier of the promotion code.

name.description: Display name of the promotion code.

description.description: The description of the promotion code.

code.description: The actual code that customers can use.

active.description: Whether this promotion code is currently active.

minimumAmount.description: Minimum amount in cents required to apply this promotion code.

firstTimeCustomersOnly.description: Whether this code can only be used by first-time customers.

limit.description:
Maximum number of times this code can be used.
Null means unlimited uses.

createdDate.description: When the promotion code was created.

expiratonDate.description:
When the promotion code expires.
Null if the code does not expire.

metadata.description: Additional metadata associated with the promotion code.

newDefaultPaymentMethodId.description: Optional ID of payment method to set as new default.

promotionId.description: Optional Promotion ID. If the provided promotion id does not exist, the request will fail.

interval.description:
Optional billing interval/pricing option.

If no interval is provided then the default pricing option will be used.

If the interval is provided but does not exist, the request will fail.

productSuite.description: The product suite of the subscription.

tier.description: 'Tier' product that the subscription is subscribed to.

addOns.description: List of of 'AddOn' products that the subscription is subscribed to.

discounts.description: List of Discounts (promotions) applied to the subscription.

interval.description:
Current billing interval of the subscription. 

Derived from the tiers billing interval. Returns 'None' if a tier is not associated to this subscription.

Currently only Monthly and Yearly are supported.

Possible values: None, Daily, Weekly, Monthly, Yearly.

quantity.description: The number of user licenses for this subscription.

createdDate.description: The created date of the subscription.

trialStatus.description:
The trial status of the subscription.

* None - The subscription is not trialing a tier or add-on.

* Trialing - The subscription is in its trial phase (on signup) or a promotion is applied and a tier or add-on is being trialed.

trialPeriodStartDate.description:
The trial period start date of the subscription.

Used in conjuction with the trial period end date to determine if the subscription is currently in trial mode.

Null if the subscription is not in trial mode.

trialPeriodEndDate.description:
The trial period end date of the subscription.

Used in conjuction with the trial period start date to determine if the subscription is currently in trial mode.

Null if the subscription is not in trial mode.

currentPeriodStartDate.description: The start date of the subscription.

currentPeriodEndDate.description: The end date of the subscription.

cancellationStatus.description:
The cancellation status of the subscription.

* None - The cancelation is not canceled and no cancelation requests have been made.
            
* Pending - The subscription has been canceled and will be canceled at a later date.
            
* Canceled - The subscription has been canceled.

Possible values: None, Pending, Canceled.

cancellationType.description:
Represents the most recent cancellation type for the subscription.

This can be used alongside the CanceledAt and CancelAt properties to determine the cancellation status and timing.

* PeriodEnd - Subscription will be canceled at the end of the billing cycle.

* Immediate - Subscription was canceled immediatly. 

* Date - If not already canceled, the subscription will be canceled at the 'CancelAt' date.

Possible values: PeriodEnd, Immediate, Date.

canceledAt.description:
If the subscription has been canceled, the date of that cancellation.

Otherwise, the date of the cancel request.

cancelAt.description: A date in the future at which the subscription will automatically get canceled and the status will change to 'Canceled'.

type.description:
The subscription change type.

* Updated

* AddOnAdded

* AddOnRemoved

* PromotionApplied

* PromotionRemoved

* Canceled

* Resumed

* PaymentMethodAdded

* PaymentMethodRemoved

* PaymentMethodSetAsDefault

* QuantityUpdated

* Created

* Advanced

tierId.description: The tier id that was set (if applicable).

addOnIds.description: The add-on ids that were set or removed (if applicable).

promotionId.description: The promotion id that was applied or removed (if applicable).

paymentMethodId.description: The payment method is that was added or removed (if applicable).

interval.description: The interval that was set (if applicable).

quantity.description: The quantity that was set (if applicable).

smokeballId.description:
Unique Smokeball identifier of the tier. 

This identifier convenience purposes only and should not be used to interact with the subscriptions API.

productSuite.description: The product suite that this tier belongs to.

name.description: The display name of the tier.

description.description:
The description of the tier.

Can be used to describe the tier to a customer.

trialPeriodDays.description:
The number of days the tier can be trialed for.

Cannot be trialed if zero or missing.

prices.description: The price options for the tier.

createdDate.description: The created date of the tier.

updatedDate.description: The updated date of the tier.

tierId.description:
Optional tier id to subscribe to.

An error is thrown if the supplied or existing add-ons are not valid for the supplied tier id.

addOnIds.description:
Optional add-on ids to subscribe to.

An error is thrown if the supplied or existing add-ons are not valid for the existing or supplied tier id.

interval.description:
Optional billing interval/pricing option to use when setting subscription tier.

If an interval is not supplied then the default interval option will be used.

If an interval is supplied but a tier is not supplied, the existing tier is used and the interval is changed.

DocumentType.description:
Available document types: "File = 0", "FormTemplate = 1", "Memo = 2" 

The FormTemplate (1) document type is not currently supported for task document creation.

createdBy.description: The staff member who created the subtask.

completedBy.description: The staff member who completed the subtask.

lastUpdatedBy.description: The staff member who last updated the subtask.

subject.description: The subject - a short description of the subtask.

isCompleted.description: True when the subtask is completed.

isDeleted.description: True when the subtask is deleted.

staffId.description: Unique identifier of the associated staff member creating or updating the subtask.

completedByStaffId.description: Unique identifier of the associated staff member who completed the subtask.

isCompleted.description: True when the subtask is completed.

completedDate.description:
Completed date of the subtask. 
If not provided and IsCompleted is set to true, the current date will be used.

SubTaskDto.description: Data transfer object for a subtask.

parentTask.description: The parent task associated to this task. Id is missing if this task is not a sub task.

createdBy.description: The staff member who created the task.

completedBy.description: The staff member who completed the task.

lastUpdatedBy.description: The staff member who last updated the task.

assignees.description: The staff member(s) assigned to the task.

subTasks.description: The tasks associated to the task.

subject.description: The subject - a short description of the task.

note.example: Contract needs to be reviewed and discussed with John

dueDate.description: The due date of the task.

isCompleted.description: True when the task is completed.

isDeleted.description: True when the task is deleted.

duration.description: Duration of the task in ISO 8601 duration format.

type.description:
The type of the document.

Possible values: File = 0, FormTemplate = 1, Memo = 2.

isDeleted.description: True when the task document has been deleted.

documentId.description:
Unique identifier of the document (file or memo).

If a file, the type must be 0 (File). 

If a memo, the type must be 2 (Memo).

The FormTemplate (1) document type is not currently supported for task document creation.

type.description:
The type of the document.

Possible values: File = 0, FormTemplate = 1, Memo = 2.

The FormTemplate (1) document type is not currently supported for task document creation.

TaskDocumentDto.description: Data transfer object for a task document.

matterId.description: Unique identifier of the matter associated to the task.

staffId.description: Unique identifier of the associated staff member creating or updating the task.

completedByStaffId.description: Unique identifier of the associated staff member completing the task.

assigneeIds.description: Unique identifier(s) of the associated staff member(s) assigned to the task.

subject.description: The subject - this should be a short description of the task.

note.example: Contract needs to be reviewed and discussed with John

isCompleted.description: True when the task is completed.

duration.description: Duration of the task in ISO 8601 duration format.

isInternal.description: Returns true if the user is flagged as an internal user.

password.description:
Password for the user.

Password must include atleast one lowercase character, uppercase character, numeric character as well as a special character.

expireAfterDays.description: Expire after the specified days. Must be left blank for users that do not expire.

isInternal.description: Creates the user as an internal user.

accountId.description: Unique identifier of the associated account.

name.description: Name or description of the subscription.
name.example: Listen to matter and contact changes

eventTypes.description: The event types that the webhook subscription is subscribed to.

eventNotificationUrl.description: The uri to notify when an event has occurred.

updatedDateUtc.description: The webhook subscription last updated date.

key.description: Unique key used for creating signature header in webhook notification requests.

name.description: Name or description of the webhook subscription.
name.example: Listen to matter and contact changes

eventTypes.description: The event types that the webhook subscription should be subscribed to.

eventNotificationUrl.description: The uri to notify when an event has occurred.
